story.iWant: after a summary is generated, I want to switch between difficulty levels without re-uploading the content
story.soThat: I can easily compare the summaries
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Implement Difficulty Switching UI (AC: 1)** - [ ] Subtask 1.1: On the summary display screen, provide UI elements (e.g., tabs, buttons) to select a different difficulty level. - [ ] **Task 2: Implement Client-side Logic (AC: 1)** - [ ] Subtask 2.1: When a new difficulty is selected, the frontend should make a new API call to `POST /api/summarize` with the same `content_id` and the new `difficulty`. - [ ] Subtask 2.2: The UI should display a loading indicator while the new summary is being generated. - [ ] Subtask 2.3: The new summary should replace the old one in the `SummaryDisplay` component. - [ ] **Task 3: Write UI Tests (AC: 1)** - [ ] Subtask 3.1: Write UI tests to verify that selecting a new difficulty triggers a new summary to be displayed.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. Given a summary is displayed, when I select a different difficulty level, then a new summary for that level is generated and displayed without leaving the page.

doc.title: QuizZum UX Design Specification
doc.snippet: User sees: Upon successful generation, a new, dedicated screen displays the multi-level summaries. Clear and intuitive UI elements (e.g., tabs, buttons, or a dropdown) are present, allowing the user to seamlessly toggle between the Easy, Medium, and Hard difficulty levels.

doc.title: QuizZum - Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: User Story: As a user, after a summary is generated, I want to switch between difficulty levels without re-uploading the content, so that I can easily compare the summaries.

file.reason: Integrate difficulty switching logic and UI into the summaries page.
Update the SummaryDisplay component to receive and display summaries based on selected difficulty.

constraints.constraint: The frontend is a Next.js application using Chakra UI.
The UI should be simple and intuitive.
The frontend should call the `POST /api/summarize` endpoint to get summaries for different difficulty levels.
Seamless switching means that the user should not perceive a page reload when changing difficulty.

tests.standards: A layered testing approach will be adopted: Unit, Integration, E2E. UI tests for seamless difficulty switching functionality.
tests.locations: Tests should be co-located with the source code. For example, `frontend/src/app/summaries/page.test.tsx` and `frontend/src/components/SummaryDisplay.test.tsx`.
tests.ideas: - Write UI tests to verify that selecting a new difficulty level initiates an API call for a new summary. - Write UI tests to confirm that the loading indicator is displayed during summary generation after difficulty switching. - Write UI tests to verify that the newly generated summary replaces the old one without a full page reload.
